name: Chiara Caressa
subtitle: CFO & Vice President Alpiq Energia Italia SpA
about: Chiara Caressa, Certified Public Accountant  and Certified Public Auditor. Board of Directors member in several legal entities (Alpiq Italia Holding included).Entire career spent within the Finance and Administration Function, primarily with American and Swiss multi-nationals in Energy and Pharma sectors. Strong in tax planning and compliance.With continuous professional development and responsibility progression, I have worked within organizations to ensure their achievement of corporate objectives, as well manage business issues and my staff’s professional development. Strong skills in: Budgeting, Forecasting, Controlling, Reporting, Administration, HR,Taxation, Credit Control, Treasury, Insurances and Compliance.  Specific know how  in process reorganization (nearshoring in East Europe) and BoD member.
experiences: Head of Finance Italy  ( Local CFO)

Fully responsible for Planning, Controlling & Reporting operations (M&A & plant controlling included), ensuring full support to Local and Corporate management. 
Supervising all Budgeting, Forecasting, Capex and sales analysis processes, for 14 Italian companies managed with a staff of 4 reporting to me.

Full responsibilities of Accounts Payable, General Accounting, Statutory-Books consolidation, Fiscal Affairs and Reporting to the Corporation. Seven legal entities managed with a staff of 10 reporting to me.
Deputy of the Service Hub's Head

•	Prepared Italian Statutory;
•	Determined income taxes (current and deferred) and supervised VAT cycle and tax return preparation.
Studio Associato Legale Tributario (Ernst & Young, Milan)

Performed a full spectrum of taxation and accounting operations for big companies, including tax advice, audit test for financial accounts, fiscal due diligence, M&A operations, tax return preparations.

Performed all administrative and fiscal activities for middle sized companies, including preparation of Statutory, tax returns and company secretarial role (preparation of Board meetings). Supervision of Payroll calculations, bank reconciliation, invoicing.

"An electricity agreement is essential for both - Europe and Switzerland - in terms of security of supply. Both sides must take this very seriously," said Johannes Teyssen, Chairman of Alpiq’s Board of Directors, in an interview with Carolin Roth at the Swiss Economic Forum in Interlaken. The possible loss of supply security is rightly perceived as the greatest crisis for society and the economy. Because: "Modern life in a digital age is not possible without a secure and stable power supply." The increase of renewable energies to secure the security of supply is a social task. "If society is not prepared to allow investments in pv, windparks and hydroelectric now and immediately, things will get tight at some point."hashtag#energytransition hashtag#securityofsupply hashtag#renewablesWatch the whole interview (in German):https://lnkd.in/egQG8ZCX
